9382f101-9e82-4eaa-a52d-6b9e7d453bc8.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Telecoms Field Operative based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of the UK telecoms network, OFCOM principles, SLAs, health and safety, GDPR and customer service principles. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include installing and repairing telecoms services, conducting risk assessments, having a safety-first mindset, meeting customer expectations, communication and organisational skills.
9382f101-9e82-4eaa-a52d-6b9e7d453bc8.name: Level 2 Telecoms Field Operative

alignments.name: Telecoms Field Operative
alignments.description: This occupation is found in the UK telecom sector. The broad purpose of the occupation is build, provide or repair telecom services for commercial or residential customers on the UK's National Telecom Access Network. Working on the copper and fibre connections to 4G & 5G services, homes and businesses from the local telephone exchanges.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Telecoms Field Operative End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Practical Demonstration, Professional Discussion underpinned with portfolio and Knowledge Test.
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Telecoms Field Operative occupational standard.
Achieved at least Level 1 English and Maths qualifications.

7c2716dd-6a92-4499-ac87-5744a9dad7c4.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Business Administrator based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of stakeholder and change management, business finance and UK regulations such as data protection. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include planning and organisation, record and document production, project management, communication, digital skills, professionalism, self-management and adaptability.
7c2716dd-6a92-4499-ac87-5744a9dad7c4.name: Level 3 Business Administrator

alignments.name: Business Administrator
alignments.description: Business Administrators have a highly transferable set of knowledge, skills and behaviours that can be applied in all sectors. The role may involve working independently or as part of a team and will involve developing, implementing, maintaining and improving administrative services.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Business Administrator End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Knowledge Test, Portfolio-based Interview and Project Presentation
Completed a minimum of 18 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Business Administrator occupational standard.
Achieved Level 2 English and Maths qualifications.

ae245758-14b0-4282-a628-35cfb1206dac.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as an Early Years Educator based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of expected patterns of children's development, learning and development theories, EYFS and legal requirements. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include planning/leading activities promoting the development, well-being and independence of children, first aid, conducting observational assessments, commitment, trust and integrity.
ae245758-14b0-4282-a628-35cfb1206dac.name: Level 3 Early Years Educator

alignments.name: Early Years Educator
alignments.description: Early Years Educators, and other job roles such as Nursery Nurse and Childminders, are highly trained professionals who play a key role in ensuring that young children learn and develop well and are kept healthy and safe. They work in a range of settings including full day care, children’s centres, preschools, reception classes and as childminders.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Early Years Educator End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-point Assessment consists of a Knowledge Test and Professional Discussion underpinned by the Portfolio.
Completed a minimum of 18 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Early Years Educator occupational standard.

Achieved Level 2 English and Maths qualifications. Achieved Level 3 Early Years Educator (EYE) qualification. Achieved a first aid qualification in line with the requirements of the EYFS Framework (Annex A).

9e16a0fd-0961-4a1a-ad89-0468674ff0f4.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as an Early Years Practitioner based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of using play to support children’s development, and identifying potential safeguarding issues/risks to children’s welfare. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include carrying out respectful care routines, supporting children in making transitions, implementing play activities, teamworking, commitment and integrity.
9e16a0fd-0961-4a1a-ad89-0468674ff0f4.name: Level 2 Early Years Practitioner

alignments.name: Early Years Practitioner
alignments.description: This occupation is found in a range of private and public settings including; full day care, children’s centres, pre-schools, reception classes, playgroups, nursery schools, home based provision, hospitals, social care settings, out of school environments and local authority provision to deliver the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Early Years Practitioner End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Knowledge Test and Professional Discussion underpinned by the Portfolio.
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Early Years Practitioner occupational standard.
Achieved at least Level 1 English and Maths qualifications. Achieved a Level 2 Early Years Practitioner (EYP) qualification.

2735ff7c-f770-4070-ab61-826d1ca58adb.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Customer Service Practitioner based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of customer relationship management (CRM), principles and practice of customer service delivery and relevant regulations, such as consumer protection. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include communication, interpersonal skills, dealing with customer conflict and challenge, self-management, team working and professionalism.
2735ff7c-f770-4070-ab61-826d1ca58adb.name: Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner

alignments.name: Customer Service Practitioner
alignments.description: Customer Service Practitioners deliver high quality products and services to the customers of their organisation. These may be one-off or routine contacts and include dealing with orders, payments, offering advice, guidance and support, sales, fixing problems, after care, service recovery or gaining insight through measuring customer satisfaction.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Customer Service Practitioner End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-point Assessment consists of an Apprentice Showcase, Practical Observation and Professional Discussion.
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Customer Service Practitioner occupational standard.
Achieved at least Level 1 English and Maths qualifications.

f6587eb9-3421-40cb-9aac-03fd633ce331.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Healthcare Support Worker based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of health interventions, person centred care, mental health and well-being, duty of care and legislation and related policies such as equality and diversity. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include providing person centred care and support, taking physiological measurements, safeguarding team working and communication.
f6587eb9-3421-40cb-9aac-03fd633ce331.name: Level 2 Healthcare Support Worker

alignments.name: Healthcare Support Worker
alignments.description: Healthcare support workers (HCSWs) work as part of a team providing high quality and compassionate care to individuals. They carry out well-defined routine clinical duties like monitoring an individual’s conditions (by checking things like blood pressure, temperature or weight), checking on their overall progress, comfort and wellbeing.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Healthcare Support Worker End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Multiple-choice Test, Observation of Practice and an Interview (supported by evidence portfolio).
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Healthcare Support Worker occupational standard.
Achieved at least Level 1 English and Maths qualifications.

ae28ceb7-758f-48e2-9a05-c9818cc463d9.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Lead Adult Care Worker based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of care planning and review, professional boundaries, duty of care and relevant statutory standards/codes of practice. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include mentoring and supporting colleagues, care management, collaborative working, safeguarding and the Six C's (care, compassion, courage, communication, competence, commitment)
ae28ceb7-758f-48e2-9a05-c9818cc463d9.name: Level 3 Lead Adult Care Worker

alignments.name: Lead Adult Care Worker
alignments.description: Lead Adult Care Workers are the frontline staff who help adults with care and support needs to achieve their personal goals and live as independently and safely as possible, enabling them to have control and choice in their lives. They also have responsibility for providing supervision, frontline leadership, guidance and direction for others.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Lead Adult Care Worker End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Situational Judgement Test and Professional Discussion.
Completed a minimum of 18 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Lead Adult Care Worker occupational standard.
Achieved Level 2 English and Maths qualifications. Achieved Level 3 Diploma in Care.

1ee2bdbf-3c64-412a-b947-9b8cec8e3e45.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as an Adult Care Worker based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of care plans, professional boundaries, duty of care and relevant statutory standards and codes of practice. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include working within a care plan, promoting health and wellbeing, collaborative working, safeguarding and the Six C's (care, compassion, courage, communication, competence and commitment).
1ee2bdbf-3c64-412a-b947-9b8cec8e3e45.name: Level 2 Adult Care Worker

alignments.name: Adult Care Worker
alignments.description: Adult Care Workers are the frontline staff who help adults with care and support needs to achieve their personal goals and live as independently and safely as possible, enabling them to have control and choice in their lives.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Adult Care Worker End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Situational Judgement Test and Professional Discussion.
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Adult Care Worker occupational standard.
Achieved at least Level 1 English and Maths qualifications. Achieved Level 2 Diploma in Care

c22506d6-bd75-492b-a7c8-b6109c5e8652.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to a range of roles in the esports industry and other related industries such as creative media, sports, digital and business. Earners can also progress to a range of higher education courses if they complete this qualification as a part of a wider programme of learning. This qualification is equivalent to one and a half A Level in UCAS points for progression to university.
c22506d6-bd75-492b-a7c8-b6109c5e8652.name: Pearson BTEC Level 3 National Foundation Diploma in Esports

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements for a Pass, Merit or Distinction grade for each of the six unit assessments within the qualification.
Completed 540 guided hours of learning against the required number of units in the specification.

82a0716c-acfd-401f-85a6-f81e9887f9ef.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Team Leader or Supervisor based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This includes applied knowledge of leadership and team management models, strategy development, diversity and inclusion, HR legal requirements and organisational governance and compliance. Skills and behaviours demonstrated include people and operational management, project management, communication, accountability, professionalism and agility.
82a0716c-acfd-401f-85a6-f81e9887f9ef.name: Level 3 Team Leader/Supervisor

alignments.name: Team Leader/Supervisor
alignments.description: A Team Leader/Supervisor is a first line management role, with operational and project responsibilities or responsibility for managing a team to deliver a clearly defined outcome. They provide direction, instructions and guidance to ensure the achievement of set goals. Working in the private, public or third sector and in all sizes of organisation.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Team Leader/Supervisor End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Presentation with questions and answers and a Professional Discussion underpinned by a portfolio of evidence.
Completed a minimum of 12 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Team Leader/Supervisor occupational standard.
Achieved Level 2 English and Maths qualifications.

594c5e09-01e5-4b98-ae05-6fdd45195351.description: Earners of the BTEC Administrator Essentials Foundation credential have completed five 30 minute elearning modules walking through essential BTEC administrative tasks including making registrations, transfers and top-ups, making entries, making claims and understanding eligibility criteria.
594c5e09-01e5-4b98-ae05-6fdd45195351.name: BTEC Administrator Essentials Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all five BTEC Administrator Essentials Foundation elearning modules.

40425b31-5546-4ea2-9c70-bad78ffd196d.description: Earners of this badge have actively participated in the pilot programme "Introduction to Leading Skills Development Programme - Early Years", enabling them to identify the key principles of: developing a quality environment; innovative approaches to children's play and learning and; assessment in the workplace.
40425b31-5546-4ea2-9c70-bad78ffd196d.name: Introduction to Leading Skills Development Programme - Early Years

badge_template_activities.title: Viewed orientation session and complete goals activity, completed pre and post session activities, actively participated in group discussions completing and submitting an action plan. Created a quality improvement plan and associated programme feedback.

skills.name: Awareness of ECER and SSTEW scales
Identify innovative approaches to play and learning
Identify international approaches to innovative play
Undertake and interpret a range of observations

ff19dcc4-8bc2-4d80-8e1b-e7e010a421e1.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to further education esports and other related sectors such as creative media, sports, digital and business. Earners can also progress to a range of Level 3 Apprenticeships if they have studied this qualification as part of a wider programme of learning. This qualification is equivalent to one full GCSE and is 120 guided learning hours covering two mandatory units.
ff19dcc4-8bc2-4d80-8e1b-e7e010a421e1.name: Pearson BTEC Level 2 Award in Esports

3efd2c4f-c7c0-47e7-9e46-c9687f2e394f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to further education in esports and other related sectors such as creative media, sports, digital and business. Earners can also progress to a range of Level 3 Apprenticeships in digital, business, and media industries. This qualification is equivalent to three full GCSEs and is 360 guided learning hours covering four mandatory units.

684ae1f1-1351-47a8-b478-487580d0405d.description: As a BTEC Bronze Award Winner, the recipient has been commended by the judges in the international BTEC Awards competition. They have demonstrated outstanding dedication and commitment to their studies. Their passion for their subject goes far beyond the classroom and their independent thinking has gained them recognition as a role model to others.

46278bcc-485f-455b-95b4-7753b014c7c5.description: The winner has been voted star performing artist at the annual BTEC Award’s Showstopper Challenge by a live audience during the BTEC Awards Ceremony. The Showstopper Challenge sees BTEC students from around the world submit a short performance into the annual competition. The finalists are then chosen to perform by our expert judges to perform at the BTEC Awards Ceremony, before a winner is selected by the audience.
46278bcc-485f-455b-95b4-7753b014c7c5.name: BTEC Awards 2021 - Showstopper Challenge Winner

The finalists are then chosen to perform by our expert judges to perform at the BTEC Awards Ceremony, before a winner is selected by the audience.

22c9e859-07b7-416f-96d9-ff73972ad7cd.description: As a BTEC Silver Award Winner, the recipient has been highly commended by the judges in the international BTEC Awards competition. b6acbc87-bc17-4ea5-9d21-fb732ed4e262.description: Earners of the badge have actively participated in the Pearson BTEC Learner insight team following their successful application. The badge is awarded to those who have been involved in two research sessions per month for a minimum time period of six months. The team consists of up to 30 people all of whom are currently studying a BTEC qualification. The earner has voiced their ideas and opinions in discussions, surveys, quick polls and positively interacted with others on the panel.
b6acbc87-bc17-4ea5-9d21-fb732ed4e262.name: Learner Insight Team

badge_template_activities.title: An active member of the Pearson BTEC Learner insight team for a minimum of 6 months.

50f72d49-bbcc-402a-9c40-ec0f384dc99a.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competence as a Sporting Excellence Professional based on the occupational standard published by IFATE. This means they can perform consistently and effectively in training environments and competitions in a range of professional sports, including cricket, football, rugby league and union, and have demonstrated knowledge and skills related to health and wellbeing, performance optimisation, injury and risk management, anti-doping, safety and inclusion.
50f72d49-bbcc-402a-9c40-ec0f384dc99a.name: Level 3 Sporting Excellence Professional

alignments.name: Sporting Excellence Professional
alignments.description: Sporting Excellence Professionals are competent to perform consistently and effectively in training environments and competitions in professional sport. They have high a level of autonomy in terms of responsibility for what happens on the field of play and need to cope with extreme pressure.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements of the Sporting Excellence Professional End-point Assessment delivered by Pearson as a registered EPAO. The End-Point Assessment consists of a Knowledge Test, Practical Observation and Professional Interview.
Completed a minimum of 18 months learning and development to meet the knowledge, skills and behaviours in the Sporting Excellence Professional occupational standard.
Achieved Level 2 English and Maths qualifications.

61543e40-9810-41c7-a2df-6d56df8629af.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to further education in esports and other related sectors such as creative media, sports, digital and business. Earners can also progress to a range of Level 3 Apprenticeships in digital, business, and media industries. This qualification is equivalent to two full GCSEs and is 240 guided learning hours covering four mandatory units.
61543e40-9810-41c7-a2df-6d56df8629af.name: Pearson BTEC Level 2 Certificate in Esports

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements for a Pass, Merit or Distinction grade for each of the four unit assessments within the qualification.
Completed 240 guided hours of learning against the required number of units in the specification.

a5a3ac34-45d5-48e4-b94f-746e00492700.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to a range of roles in the esports industry and other related industries such as creative media, sports, digital and business. The breadth of optional content in this qualification gives earners the opportunity to progress to a wider range of higher education courses. This qualification is equivalent to two A Levels in UCAS points for progression to university.
a5a3ac34-45d5-48e4-b94f-746e00492700.name: Pearson BTEC Level 3 National Diploma in Esports

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully met the requirements for a Pass, Merit or Distinction grade for each of the nine unit assessments within the qualification.
Completed 720 guided hours of learning against the required number of units in the specification.

f032f69f-9d37-4432-9ba4-31d2ffc34042.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and technical and transferable skills to enable them to progress to a range of roles in the esports industry and other related industries such as creative media, sports, digital and business. The breadth of optional content in this qualification gives earners the opportunity to progress to a wider range of higher education courses. This qualification is equivalent to three A Levels in UCAS points for progression to university.
f032f69f-9d37-4432-9ba4-31d2ffc34042.name: Pearson BTEC Level 3 National Extended Diploma in Esports

Completed 1080 guided hours of learning against the required number of units in the specification.

5b448b5d-0811-4ed6-807e-9dc0ac00397a.description: Individuals achieving the certificate have developed the underlying knowledge and skills to support teaching and learning practice for technical and vocatonal higher education. They use reflective practice to analyse their teaching pratcice in order to enhance learning for higher education.
5b448b5d-0811-4ed6-807e-9dc0ac00397a.name: Teacher Training for Technical and Vocational Learning (TVET) in Higher Education

badge_template_activities.title: Delegates have attended 6 live sessions on Technical and Vocational Learning in Higher Education including elements on an introduction to Teaching and Learning, Principles of Assessment and Feedback, Assignments for Technical and Vocational Education, Grading and Marking, Quality Assurance to Quality Enhancement, and their next steps of their reflective journey. As part of this programme delegates have completed reflective exercises on their own teaching styles and how this can be adapted.

56dc7bc5-c5c4-4537-aff6-42c2e82032b0.description: Earners of the badge have acted as coaches to the student participants of the WLIOT Innovation Challenge, 5 day workshop. The Challenge is a 5 day workshop that provides students with an experience centred on undertaking a ‘real world’ challenge set by external organisation. The Innovation Coaches, recruited from the Brunel Doctoral Researchers Team, work directly with the students to support them through the 5 day workshop and assist the workshop tutors.
56dc7bc5-c5c4-4537-aff6-42c2e82032b0.name: West London Institute of Technology: Innovation Challenge Coach

badge_template_activities.title: The responsibilities of the Innovation Coaches included; supervising the student teams, supporting workshop activity and teaching staff, coaching the innovation process and methods, as well as softer skills e.g. listening, questioning, encouraging reflection, helping students focus on activity goals, encouragement, motivation and time management of activity, feedback to tutors or workshop issues, and production of Innovation Theory Videos.

The Innovation Coaches supervised all workshop activities, providing feedback to students on all activities undertaken in the workshop environment with the aim being to develop the students innovation skills, the right behaviours for collaboration and to build their knowledge about innovation. No formal assessment of students was undertaken by the coaches.

Innovation Coaches earned this badge by being part of the Innovation Challenge workshop design and delivery team. They worked with WLIOT Tutors in creation of the workshop concept, planning and preparation for the 5 days, coaching the students through the 5 days to enhance the student experience and outcomes, providing feedback on student performance and to evaluate the workshop concept and their own experiences.

To support the coaches with their own personal and professional development, aligned to their doctoral studies, WLIOT tutors, the challenge provider and students also provided informal feedback on the coaches.

8b04c438-c962-4a66-b27b-a9b6f7094929.description: Earners of this badge participated in the Innovation Challenge. The Challenge is a 5 day workshop that provides students with an Learning experience centred on undertaking a ‘real world’ challenge set by external organisation. Students work in small teams to learn practical innovation methods and in so doing, gain employability skills not usually taught in other, mainly discipline centred courses. The challenge is for all the level 5 WLIOT students on engineering and computer technology courses.
8b04c438-c962-4a66-b27b-a9b6f7094929.name: West London Institute of Technology: Innovation Challenge Student

alignments.name: Double Diamond Framework - The Design Council
alignments.description: The Double Diamond is a visual representation of the design and innovation process. It’s a simple way to describe the steps taken in any design and innovation project, irrespective of methods and tools used. The workshop reflects the innovation roadmap expressed in the Double Diamond Framework.

badge_template_activities.title: The 5 day workshop was broken down over 4 separate stages of work, reflecting the innovation roadmap expressed in the Design Council’s, Double Diamond Framework. There was no formal assessment. Students undertook a self-reflection exercise at the end of each day. A judging panel of WLIOT tutors evaluated proposals and provided feedback on day 5.

Day 1 DISCOVER - Students had to use research methods to discover more about the challenge brief and associated factors that would drive any new solutions. This involved desk research and limited primary research to understand user needs, issues related to the technology, commercial opportunities and, deployment environment. This stage of work helped students gain a better understanding of the opportunities for new product and service innovation.

Day 2 DEFINE - The goal here was to define a product or service concept, based on the learnings acquired from the research undertaken on Day 1. Activities centred on the rapid generation of ideas for new product and service concepts using the insights gained on Day 1. Each team generated a range of ideas that responded to the innovation opportunities identified in Day 1. From this each team selected their most promising ‘single best idea' to develop further into a practical ‘concept proposal'.

Day 3 DEVELOP - Students had to develop a simple prototype of the ‘single best idea’ selected in the previous session, testing key aspects of the concept represented in the simple prototype with others outside of their own team and then learning from this process to enable any ‘must have’ revisions to be implemented. At the end of the session, each team had further developed their ‘idea’ into a more refined and evaluated, single concept proposal.

Day 4 DELIVER - This stage focused on students developing their ‘pitch presentation based on outputs from the previous 3 days of activity. Pitch presentations were based on a basic template provided during the workshop to ensure focus and consistency. A number of criteria had to be addressed in final concept submissions, including: Desirability - Meeting User-needs, Level of innovation achieved, Viability - Commercial potential of proposal, Sustainability and Practicality.

Day 5 PITCH - The 5 days culminated with the Pitch day, where teams presented their proposed solution in a 5 minutes long presentation to a panel of invited judges who also asked the teams questions. Team submissions were then assessed by panel of judges and final verbal feedback provided. WLIOT provided awards to all participating students and for exceptional submissions including the digital badge as evidence of participation.
